intro: Platylepis densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered flat-leaf heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and evergreen, adapted to thrive in well-drained, acidic soils. Platylepis densiflora is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it forms low-growing, hardy shrubs.
